title: NA60031: Mechanics Of Floating Bodies - Quick Facts
text:
NA60031
Course name | MECHANICS OF FLOATING BODIES
Offered by | Ocean Engineering & Naval Architecture
Credits | 4
L-T-P | 3-1-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | {{{semester}}}

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Types of ships. Principal dimensions and form coefficients. Classification Societies and statutory regulations. Ship hydrostatics. Stability and trim of free floating bodies. Ship measurements : deadweight, capacity and tonnage. Structural members of a ship, ships longitudinal strength. Ship resistance components and their estimation. Propeller and rudder. Ship hull vibration.
